wikipedia_page.main: Percy Weston (27 March 1852 – 30 June 1905) was an English amateur athlete who played for England in two of the unofficial football matches against Scotland in 1871 and 1872. In his professional life, he was a successful stockbroker.

response: * Percy Weston (1852–1905), played football for England in 1871 and 1872

Her mother was born Beatrice Dorothy Percy Weston. Her father had a successful naval career as a senior officer. In the year Ursula Duncan was born he started a War Office job in London,John Alexander Duncan, naval officer from which he retired in 1919. For much of his daughter's life he was a locally prominent landowner with a specialist interest in breeding Suffolk sheep.The Flock Book of Suffolk Sheep, Volume 63, page X Frances Louise was Mrs. Frances Gunner at the time of her sister's death.
